label: 平織
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 57th  . Nara National Museum . 2005
説明文: The most stable and fundamental weave structure, in which each warp successively passes over one and under one weft and each weft successively passes over one and under one warp. Plain-weave textiles in the Shōsō-in include those made of silk, such as ashiginu, and those made of bast fibers like hemp or ramie. [正倉院、絁]
